item.title: How to cache SSH/OpenGPG keys with keychain
item.description: I recently struggled to get keychain work with git when signing commits, so this tutorial will specifically reference git but hopefully will provide enough valuable information for other scenarios. Setup I will not go into the creation of ssh/gpg keys or how to set them up on github. There are enough tutorials out there for it already like, Github GPG Key Github SSH Key Configuring git Skip if you don't plan on signing your commits with commit -S Some distributions like Ubuntu provide two gpg executables, gpg and gpg2.
